What is the impact on food safety activities?

During a shutdown, the FDA is unable to support the majority of its food safety activities.  The 2013 16-day shutdown sharply curtailed critical FDA food safety inspections of domestic and international food facilities.

What is the impact on small businesses?

A shutdown halts federal loans to small businesses.  During a shutdown, the Small Business Adminisitration stops approving applications for small businesses to obtain loans and loan guarantees, typically $1 billion per month.
Regarding their pay, the Washington Post reports, “There would be no gap in their pay unless the shutdown lasted past February 1,

What is the impact on U.S. military personnel?

The Defense Department issued guidance today saying that in the event of a shutdown, “Military personnel on active duty, including reserve component personnel on federal active duty, will continue to report for duty...

What is the impact on veterans’ services?

During a government shutdown, all VA medical facilities and clinics will remain fully operational.  However, VA call centers and hotlines cease to function, and Veterans Benefits Administration public contact services are not available.

Shutdown is a failure in leadership: Speaker who can’t bring a full year’s funding bill to the floor. President who rescinded DACA & won’t honor the agreement made to save it. Members of Congress who enable this and fail to insist on full year funding & keeping families together

How will the shutdown affect FEMA natural disaster clean-up efforts?

Unclear how ongoing FEMA recovery efforts from recent hurricanes & wildfires will be impacted. FEMA staff would still respond to emergencies, but Admin has not clarified how many workers.

Will I still be able to visit the national parks and monuments?

During the 2013 16-day shutdown, national parks, national monuments, & the Smithsonian museums were closed.However, the Trump Admin has announced that it will work to keep national parks “as accessible as possible”

Will my mail still arrive?

Yes.  The approximately 500,000 Postal Service employees are exempt from furlough because the Postal Service is self-funded.

Will I continue to receive my Social Security and SSI checks? 

During a government shutdown, recipients will continue to receive their Social Security and SSI checks.  However, a shutdown suspends the issuance of Social Security cards.

What about air traffic?
   
Air traffic control and the @TSA continue to receive funding during the shutdown. These essential services are not affected.

How does this effect #SmallBiz?
   
The @SBAgov stops operating its core lending & investment programs during a shutdown, meaning no new applications for loans will be granted.

Will our veterans continue to get the services they've earned and deserve?
   
All @DeptVetAffairs medical facilities and clinics will operate as usual, however, call centers and hotlines will be off. Additionally, @VAVetBenefits public contact services are unavailable.

Will we still get our mail?
   
Yes. The @USPS  is self-funded so the 500K employees are not included in the shutdown.

What about the military? Will they get paid?
   
@DeptofDefense said yesterday that all active duty military personnel will report for duty during the shutdown. According to the @washingtonpost, their pay will not be interrupted as long as the #TrumpShutdown ends before Feb 1.

How does this effect Social Security and SSI checks?
   
While during a shutdown no new social security cards are issued, all social security recipients will continue to get their benefits.

...I hope this information helps & that the #Trumpshutdown doesn’t last long.

11/11

What is the impact on food safety activities?

The FDA is unable to support the majority of its food safety activities. 
10/11

What is the impact on medical research & the CDC?

NIH shuts down most medical research & the CDC has to stop flu season monitoring, as well as treatment & prevention recommendations. 
9/11

What is the impact on federal housing loans?

The Federal Housing Administration stops approving applications for housing loans. 
8/11

What is the impact on small businesses?

The shutdown halts federal loans to small businesses.
7/11

What is the impact on US military personnel?

The Defense Department says, “Military personnel on active duty, including reserve component personnel on federal active duty, will continue to report for duty and carry out assigned duties.” 
6/11

What is the impact on veterans’ services?

All VA medical facilities & clinics remain fully operational. However, VA call centers & Veterans Benefits Admin public contact services are not available.
5/11

Will I still be able to visit the national parks and monuments?

During the 2013 shutdown, national parks, monuments & Smithsonian museums were closed. The Trump Admin said it will work to keep national parks “as accessible as possible.”
4/11

Will my mail still arrive?

Yes. The ~500,000 Postal Service employees are exempt from a furlough because the Postal Service is self-funded.
3/11

Will I continue to receive my Social Security & SSI checks?

Yes. You’ll continue to receive Social Security & SSI checks. However, new Social Security cards will not be issued.
2/11
